Flub.Name: Ultra
Flub.Description: The highest quality AO. It takes quite a long time to calculate but produces very good results. This is the recommended quality when baking Lighting for high resolution assets with small details.

Flub.Name: High
Flub.Description: Higher quality AO that is slower to calculate. It is useful when you have small, intricate shapes.

Flub.Name: Medium
Flub.Description: The default value. A good balance between quality and speed.

Flub.Name: Low
Flub.Description: Low quality Ambient Occlusion. This is quite sufficient in many situations.

Flub.Name: Sun angular diameter
Flub.Description: This property controls the softness of the shadows.

Flub.Name: Exposure
Flub.Description: The exposure for the render. Use this just like the exposure value in a camera.

Flub.Name: Haze
Flub.Description: The amount of haze in the atmosphere. This can make the sunlight whiter and less saturated.

Flub.Name: Ozone layer thickness
Flub.Description: Thickness of the ozone in the atmosphere. This adds a slight blue tinge to the ambient light.

Flub.Name: Automatic colors
Flub.Description: Generate colors automatically based on sun angle and other conditions.

Flub.Name: Sun color
Flub.Description: The color of the direct sunlight. Only available when Automatic Colors is disabled.

Flub.Name: Ambient color
Flub.Description: The color of the ambient light. Only available when Automatic Colors is disabled.

Flub.Name: Ground brightness
Flub.Description: Brightness of the ground. This controls the color of the terrain when no color map is provided.

Flub.Name: Soft clip
Flub.Description: Convert HDR color values to LDR values by soft clipping. This prevents over and under-exposure.
